sentence.Network_en: He picked up his first booking for a 45th-minute foul on Bull.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因为在比赛进行到第45分钟时对公牛队犯规而被第一次记名警告。

sentence.Network_en: A late booking may involve you in extra cost.
sentence.Network_cn: 预订晚了的话你可能要额外多花钱。

sentence.Network_en: Those booking a block of seats get them at reduced rates.
sentence.Network_cn: 团体订座可享受折扣价。

entry.def: A booking is the arrangement that you make when you book something such as a hotel room, a table at a restaurant, a theatre seat, or a place on public transport.

example.ex: I suggest you tell him there was a mistake over his late booking.
example.tran: 我建议你告诉他，他应该及早预订。

means.word_mean: 1. employment for performers or performing groups that lasts for a limited period of time;

sentences.sentence: "the play had bookings throughout the summer"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of reserving (a place or passage) or engaging the services of (a person or group);

Sentence.sentence: For many families the recession means more than not booking a holiday A You Gov poll of 2, 000 people found 22% said they were arguing more with their partners because of concerns about money.

We've had more people booking in the first quarter of this year than last," says Hubert Moineau, founder of Tselana Travel, which is planning to introduce a new program of longer adventure trips, including polar expeditions and cruises in the Galápagos.
tour operator Explore has been surprised to see an increase in last-minute bookings of high-priced trips to such places as India, Bhutan and Nepal.

sentences.en: All booking must be made by post.
sentences.cn: 所有的预订工作均可来信办理。

sentences.en: She has bookings for several concerts.
sentences.cn: 她签订了几个音乐会的演出合同。
